intro: Paronychia angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its narrow, linear leaves are arranged oppositely along the stem, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Paronychia angustifolia is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
